Approach Cabin.text: The door to the cabin seems sturdy enough at a glance and you can hear movement inside. Breaking in would be difficult and surely agitate whoever dwells within. What will you do?

nodes: Try to tear it off its Hinges
Break In.text: You get ready to break the door down, no matter what is inside. What will you use to accomplish this?

Change your Mind.text: On second thought, breaking and entering isn't what you would like to do today.

Destroy with Chop Weapon.text:
You look down at your weapon and smile. It has just the right edge for chopping and would make short work of the door. 

Your weapon makes contact with the wood with a boom that sends nearby birds flying from their nests. You hear movement from inside, best not to stop now. Another chop sends splinters flying into the dirt. One more, and you can see inside. A final hit, and the wood surrounding the doorknob is hacked clean off, leaving the door to slide lazily on its hinges.

The man inside draws a knife from his belt and gets ready for combat. With a grin, you do the same.

Destroy with FireBolt.text:
Wood is meant to be burned, right? With a modicum of concentration, flames erupt from your open palm. Concentrating the fire down into a small orb, you stand back and lob the projectile at the door. The fireball explodes on impact, creating a small hole in the wood that smoulders with latent embers. 

You can easily reach the other side of the doorknob now. You reach in, unlocking the door and swing it open to reveal its terrified occupant. He readies a knife he had holstered on his hip and takes a step forward. You ready yourself for combat.

Destroy with ForceBurst.text:
The door is sturdy enough, but with an adequate amount of force one can break down any door, and you happen to have quite the forceful spell memorized. You chant a quiet prayer under your breath, and gather the winds of Beltyr. All at once you release the pent up energy in a massive burst, sending the door flying off of its hinges and into the cabin. 

The man inside draws a knife from his waist and readies himself for combat. You do the same.

Destroy with Thunderbolt.text:
An image springs to your mind as you gaze upon the door, one of a tree cleaved clean in half by a bolt of lightning. You smile, and begin to charge up electricity in your fingertips. Pointing them at your target, you release a bolt of lightning at the door causing the very fibers of the material to explode in a thousand directions. The smell of ozone is in the air.

The man inside hastily draws a knife from his waist and readies himself for combat. You do the same.

Don't Hurt Me.text: Wait, there's no need to be hasty! I've got a few things lying around that I don't really need... that much... Here, take this bundle of furs I've been saving. They should fetch a good price!

East.text: You follow the direction the signage points to. If nothing else, the elevation of the mountain will make naviation easier.

Food?.text: Meat? I'm hungry and I want meat. Every time I try to catch an animal it runs away. Can I have some of yours?

Give me whatever you have.text: But you're still breathing, which means you still have something left to live for. Hand it over.

Good Luck.text: That's a good joke lad. Now, I've done enough talking for the day. You best be on your way.

Have you tried shooting it?.text: Well kid, have you tried shooting at them? You know, using something with range? That's typically how hunting works.

Haven't Shot at Them.text: Yea but they move too quick. It's not fair, they should stand still like the straw targets do.

He does This.text: The man slams the door in your face so hard it rocks on its hinges and you can hear the faint clunk of the lock engaging once again.

nodes: I'll take them out for you
How Many.text: I haven't ever been to their camp myself to see, but they always send at least five men over every time they want to extort me. And given how they've burned so many homes and an entire town to the ground, I would say that there's a sizable amount of them

How about no.text: Or, hypothetically, I could instead do this:

How many are there.text: How many of them do you think there are?

I want your stuff.text: Oh yea, well I want your stuff and I'm gonna take it if you don't give it to me!

I'll take them out for you.text: Those bandits need to go. I'll take them out for you, don't worry.
I'll take them out for you.thisNodeName: I'll take them out for you

Inspect Surroundings.text: The forest surrounds you, blotting out most details of the surroundings, though you can make out the shape of some tower to the south. Thankfully, there are several paths cutting through the forest you can take from here. The cabin in front of you seems occupied with smoke rising from its chimney and animal skins left out to dry in a shed besides the main structure. Approach the cabin or move on?

Knock.text: I thought I told ya'll that I have no meat left to spare! I can barely keep myself fed let alone make a living like this!

Knock Again.text: There is no response from the door when you knock.

Leave.text:
You've seen enough. Where will you go next? 

=-North-> A path leads deep into the forest
=-East--> Signage along this path indicates that it leads to Mt. Spartan.
=-South-> A path winds its way towards a lone tower in the distance.
=-West--> A path leads deep into the forest

North.text: You trudge along the barely visible path deeper into the forest.

Now Leave.text: You step back outside of the doorframe and he closes the door behind you. You hear the lock clunk into place as you step away.

Please go Away.text: By the 7... Look kid. How about this, I give you some food, some nice tasty meat, and you go along and have a good time out in the nice forest far away from me. Would you do that?

South.text: That tower in the distance intrigues you. What could it contain, and what else is around it?

Take the Furs.text: You grab the bundle of furs from the man, running your hands over them in the process. They're of some kind of small game animal and are as soft as silk. Before you can appreciate the many more however, the man shoves you out of the doorframe and back outside. The door slams shut before you can react.

Tear it off its Hinges.text:
You assume an agressive stance and charge at the door, slamming into it with the might of a bull. It rocks on its hinges once, twice, then gives way to its terrified occupant.

He draws a short knife from his waist and gets ready for combat. With no other option left, you join him.

The Bandits.text: Who else would I be referring to stone-brain? I'm talking about that bandit gang to the west. They've been bleeding me dry of any game I kill to the point I'm having trouble feeding myself, let alone enough to make a living.

Threaten Failure.text: And we’re… uh… very hungry and want food. Give us the food or we will… hurt you!

Threaten Success.text: And we’ve got a lot of people to feed over there. Either you give us what we need or things could happen to someone.

Tried to Shoot at Them.text: No, bows hurt my arm and crossbows are too hard to load.

Try Knocking.text: You knock on the door. After a moment of silence the door swings open to reveal a rugged man of middle age. Before you can take in any more details he barks out:

Try to tear it off its Hinges.text: Try as you might, the door just won't seem to budge. Worse still, the noise you made seems to have alerted the occupant of the cabin. You hear another bolt click into place as another lock on the door latches shut. Whatever hope you had of breaking down the door before is gone now.
Try to tear it off its Hinges.thisNodeName: Try to tear it off its Hinges

West.text: You trudge along the barely visible path deeper into the forest.

nodes: I'll take them out for you
Where they are.text: They're held up in the ruins of old Lamba, a small town they overrun and destroyed. It's to the west, just past the ruins of Fort Randal.

You aren't with Them.text: You aren't with them, are you? Those conniving, back-stabbing, chunks of horse excrement!
